verses.verse: "Now these are the ordinances<WH4941> which you shall set<WH7760> before them.<WH6440>
"If you buy<WH7069> a Hebrew<WH5680> servant,<WH5650> he shall serve<WH5647> six<WH8337> years<WH8141> and in the seventh<WH7637> he shall go out<WH3318> free<WH2670> without paying anything.<WH2600>
If he comes in<WH935> by himself,<WH1610> he shall go out<WH3318> by himself.<WH1610> If he is married,<WH1167> then his wife<WH802> shall go out with him.<WH3318>

If his master<WH113> gives<WH5414> him a wife<WH802> and she bears<WH3205> him sons<WH1121> or daughters,<WH1323> the wife<WH802> and her children<WH1121> shall be her master<WH113>'s, and he shall go out<WH3318> by himself.<WH1610>
But if the servant<WH5650> shall plainly<WH559> say,<WH559> <WH157> 'I love my master,<WH113> my wife,<WH802> and my children.<WH1121> I will not go out<WH3318> free;<WH2670>'

then his master<WH113> shall bring<WH5066> him to God,<WH430> and shall bring<WH5066> him to the door<WH1817> or to the doorpost,<WH4201> and his master<WH113> shall bore<WH7527> his ear<WH241> through with an awl,<WH4836> and he shall serve<WH5647> him for ever.<WH5769>
"If a man<WH376> sells<WH4376> his daughter<WH1323> to be a female servant,<WH519> she shall not go out<WH3318> as the male servants<WH5650> do.<WH3318>

If she doesn't<WH7451> please her master,<WH113> who has married<WH3259> her to himself,<WH6299> then he shall let her be redeemed. He shall have no right<WH4910> to sell<WH4376> her to a foreign<WH5237> people,<WH5971> since he has dealt deceitfully with her.<WH898>
If he marries<WH3259> her to his son,<WH1121> he shall deal<WH6213> with her as<WH4941> a daughter.<WH1323>
If he takes<WH3947> another<WH312> wife to himself,<WH1639> he shall not diminish her food,<WH7607> her clothing,<WH3682> and her marital rights.<WH5772>
If he doesn't<WH6213> do these three<WH7969> things for her,<WH3318> she may go free<WH2600> without paying any money.<WH3701>
"One who strikes<WH5221> a man<WH376> so that he dies<WH4191> shall surely<WH4191> be put to death,<WH4191>
but not if it is unintentional,<WH6658> but God<WH430> allows<WH579> it to happen:<WH3027> then I will appoint<WH7760> you a place<WH4725> where he shall flee.<WH5127>
If a man<WH376> schemes<WH6195> and comes presumptuously<WH2102> on his neighbor<WH7453> to kill<WH2026> him,<WH3947> you shall take him from my altar,<WH4196> that he may die.<WH4191>
"Anyone who attacks<WH5221> his father<WH1> or his mother<WH517> shall be surely<WH4191> put to death.<WH4191>
"Anyone who kidnaps<WH1589> someone<WH376> and sells<WH4376> him,<WH4672> or if he is found in his hand,<WH3027> he shall surely<WH4191> be put to death.<WH4191>
"Anyone who curses<WH7043> his father<WH1> or his mother<WH517> shall surely<WH4191> be put to death.<WH4191>
"If men<WH582> quarrel<WH7378> and one<WH376> strikes<WH5221> the other<WH7453> with a stone,<WH68> or<WH176> with his fist,<WH106> and he doesn't<WH4191> die, but is confined<WH5307> to bed;<WH4904>

if he rises again<WH6965> and walks<WH1980> around with his staff,<WH4938> then he who struck<WH5221> him shall be cleared:<WH5414> only he shall pay for the loss of his time,<WH7674> and shall provide<WH5414> for his healing until<WH7674> he is thoroughly<WH7495> healed.<WH7495>
"If a man<WH376> strikes<WH5221> his servant<WH5650> or his maid<WH519> with a rod,<WH7626> and he dies<WH4191> under his hand,<WH3027> he shall surely<WH5358> be punished.<WH5358>
Notwithstanding,<WH389> if he gets<WH5975> up after a day<WH3117> or two,<WH8147> he shall not be punished,<WH5358> for he is his property.<WH3701>

"If men<WH582> fight<WH5327> and hurt<WH5062> a pregnant<WH2030> woman<WH802> so that she gives birth<WH3206> prematurely,<WH3318> and yet no harm follows,<WH611> he shall be surely<WH6064> fined<WH6064> as much<WH5414> as the woman<WH802>'s husband<WH1167> demands<WH7896> and the judges allow.<WH6414>
But if any harm follows,<WH611> then you must take<WH5414> life<WH5315> for life,<WH5315>
eye<WH5869> for eye,<WH5869> tooth<WH8127> for tooth,<WH8127> hand<WH3027> for hand,<WH3027> foot<WH7272> for foot,<WH7272>
burning<WH3555> for burning,<WH3555> wound<WH6482> for wound,<WH6482> and bruise<WH2250> for bruise.<WH2250>

"If a man<WH376> strikes<WH5221> his servant<WH5650>'s eye,<WH5869> or his maid<WH519>'s eye,<WH5869> and destroys<WH7843> it,<WH7971> he shall let him go free<WH2670> for<WH8478> his eye<WH5869>'s sake.
If he strikes<WH5307> out his male servant<WH5650>'s tooth,<WH8127> or his female servant<WH519>'s tooth,<WH8127> he shall let him go<WH7971> free<WH2670> for his tooth<WH8127>'s sake.

"If a bull<WH7794> gores<WH5055> a man<WH376> or a woman<WH802> to death,<WH4191> the bull<WH7794> shall surely<WH5619> be stoned,<WH5619> and its flesh<WH1320> shall not be eaten;<WH398> but the owner<WH1167> of the bull<WH7794> shall not be held responsible.<WH5355>

But if the bull<WH7794> had a habit of goring<WH5056> in the past,<WH8543> and it has been testified<WH5749> to its owner,<WH1167> and he has not kept<WH8104> it in,<WH4191> but it has killed a man<WH376> or a woman,<WH802> the bull<WH7794> shall be stoned,<WH5619> and its owner<WH1167> shall also be put to death.<WH4191>
If a ransom<WH3724> is laid<WH7896> on him,<WH5414> then he shall give for the redemption<WH6306> of his life<WH5315> whatever is laid on him.<WH7896>
Whether it has gored<WH5055> a son<WH1121> or<WH176> has gored<WH5055> a daughter,<WH1323> according to this judgment<WH4941> it shall be done to him.<WH6213>

If the bull<WH7794> gores<WH5055> a male servant<WH5650> or a female servant,<WH519> thirty<WH7970> shekels<WH8255> of silver<WH3701> shall be given<WH5414> to their master,<WH113> and the ox<WH7794> shall be stoned.<WH5619>
"If a man<WH376> opens<WH6605> a pit,<WH953> or if a man<WH376> digs<WH3738> a pit<WH953> and doesn't<WH3680> cover it,<WH7794> and a bull or a donkey<WH2543> falls into it,<WH5307>
the owner<WH1167> of the pit<WH953> shall make it good.<WH7999> He shall give<WH7725> money<WH3701> to its owner,<WH1167> and the dead animal shall be his.<WH4191>

"If one man<WH376>'s bull<WH7794> injures<WH5062> another<WH7453>'s, so that it dies,<WH4191> then they shall sell<WH4376> the live<WH2416> bull,<WH7794> and divide<WH2673> its price;<WH3701> and they shall also divide<WH2673> the dead animal.<WH4191>

Or if it is known<WH3045> that the bull<WH7794> was in the habit of goring<WH5056> in the past,<WH8543> and its owner<WH1167> has not kept<WH8104> it in,<WH7999> he shall surely pay<WH7999> bull<WH7794> for bull,<WH7794> and the dead animal shall be his own.<WH4191>
